Frequently Asked Questions

Help & Support

Frequently Asked Questions

Find quick answers to common questions about Capital Hub's services.

We provide a comprehensive range of financial solutions tailored to your business needs. This includes short-term options like factoring and working capital lines, medium-to-long term solutions like equipment leasing and investment loans, as well as access to non-reimbursable funds (EU grants, PNRR) and alternative financing through fintechs and private investors.
Eligibility varies depending on the specific financial product. Generally, for bank financing, we look for companies with at least 12 months of activity and positive financial results. However, for startups and early-stage companies, we have specific solutions like grants, micro-loans, or angel investment opportunities that have different criteria focused on innovation and growth potential.
The timeline depends on the complexity of the request and the type of financing. Simple working capital lines or factoring can often be arranged within 1-2 weeks. More complex investment loans or EU grant applications may take 1-3 months. Our role is to expedite this process by ensuring all documentation is perfect before submission.
We believe in a success-based partnership. For most intermediation services, our fees are success-based, meaning we only get paid when you secure your funding. For complex consultancy projects requiring extensive preparation (like EU grants or business restructuring), we may have a transparent fee structure that includes a small retainer, which will be clearly discussed upfront.
Yes, absolutely. Often, applications are rejected due to incomplete documentation or poor presentation rather than the business's actual viability. We perform a deep diagnostic of your financial health, identify the reasons for rejection, and help restructure your application or find alternative funding partners better suited to your risk profile.
We are industry-agnostic and have successfully helped clients in Manufacturing, Construction, IT & Tech, Retail, Transport, and Agriculture. Our team includes specialists who understand the specific financial cycles and capital needs of different market sectors.

Still have questions?

Can’t find the answer you’re looking for? Our financial experts are available to chat and guide you to the right solution.
